commit message:
- XMLRPC calls dynamically constructed by annotation reflection
- dynamic sensor toggle config view
fix for single object xmlrpc method responses and more battery methods
additional layouts for a new ui
check if thread is already running

de-object[]ified xmlrpc integration
separated network location and gps sensors
sensor view progress
improved sensor debug output and display

enabling sensors, which are not available or are excepting due to other
reasons, should not kill the application anymore
startup does not need a context
first attempt at making the sensor code autostart on bootup
Manifest add permission for wifi and bluetooth

application autostarts sensorservice on boot (unconfigurable and still
has issues)
preference-based sensor settings prototype (not yet working)
preference view with configurable autostart and sensors
added sensor test case for getting object and timestamp as return value
handle when return value is null
handle when return value is null
handle adding device to list when device does not exist
sensors view with (initially) network location and radio information

rudimentary privacy settings
atm only enabled for networklocsensor's lat/long

SensorValue enums
slightly improved sensor display
radio network type and dBm calculation
added a device sensor, which provides the TAC and vendor/model name
sensor values in list, although as string
signalstrength() now actually returns the signal strength

removed value push from the update listener, use value push
via reflection instead
GPS overhaul and possible fixes to the SensorViewArrayAdapter
wifi scan and wifi connection in two sensors

radio sensor should survive disabling the radio and shows additional
information

reenabled privacy extension for xmlrpcmethods returning a SensorValue;
may need improved PrivacyHelper methods
display sensor privacy level in the sensors view
sensors now read and set their privacy state during enable()
all sensor values are now unset when a sensor is disabled
fixed and reduced sensor log buffer size

removed the enable checkbox from the preferences; the privacy level
slider now provides the same functionality
began refactoring privacy code; base64 requires api level 8
fixed disabling wifi connection sensor #5 (BT to be fixed soon)
some class stubs to split up the privacy module
make wifiFilter class field in order to register/unregister #5 #6

Added more XMLRPC data types
Updated license headers
about dialog box with first-use information
work in progress interface&ip address iterator
add reverse geocoding in GPS and network location sensors
now writes sensor data to json files on external storage
https uploader skeleton and imported potentially needed libraries
preliminary data upload test button in the preferences
always log the current privacy level for the sensor
moved external interface classes to new packages
work on making the xmlrpc thread stoppable through the preferences
close the listening socket when we stop the xmlrpc interface
attempt to persist the https uploader prefs
auto uploader respects wifi pref and can be cancelled
preliminary moved the autoupload runnable to the jsonlogger

if enabled, autostart should now start automatically with the sensor
service
backup existing json logs on start
inverted privacy-level integer values to make more sense

removed static context from AbstractSensor
fixing up privacy-level sliders, part #1

sensors are now dynamically loaded from the class names defined in
res/values/sensors.xml
initial draft for a preference loader from json files and sample file
moved preference-related classes to new package
moved preference retrieval to additional thread
sets app preferences from remote file
centralized preferences and remote configuration retrieval
set minimum upload interval to 300 seconds
only attempt to upload if url is valid
upload client supports https and auth by post user/pw

use SensorValue copy constructor in the privacy anonymize method to
avoid overwriting the original values

temporarily renamed package to at.univie.sensorium.o3gm for the demo
version
use SensorRegistry.TAG instead of hardcoded log entry name
attemt to fix privacy state of displayed and logged values

attempt to fix NPE on FileNotFound (permission denied) probably due to a
not yet mounted external storage device
check if external media is r/w mounted
force light background for the http upload preference dialog

http upload dialogpreference should now always close on pressing
ok/cancel
Replaced Umlauts and stuff with HTML entities... Oh, 1990!

moved sensor timestamp and updating to AbstractSensor (overwrite
updateTimestamp() to implement your custom timestamp if needed)
move packages back to original non-o3gm layout

Merge branch 'master' of github.com:fmetzger/android-sensorium

Sensorium/AndroidManifest.xml
Sensorium/src/at/univie/sensorium/sensors/RadioSensor.java
added a formatted timestamp as a separate field in the sensor views

added atmospheric pressure sensor, that some devices (mostly samsung)
have
made sensor name value private and provide a protected setter
readded netsys information in a separate file
decreased pressure sensor update interval to 30 seconds

loading preferences from a url provided by a play store campaign name
referrer should work now
sensor based on the new (play services) fused location provider api
changed description of highest privacy level

more informative http upload result
Sensorium version number in device info
sensor for values stored on the SIM

ant build files
do not use the fused location sensor by default (and do not import
google play services)

This reverts commit 727fbdc6a2dfac16e1fce8832795c89a1dda6921.

This reverts commit b97aafefdae82e47feda10ceb3e0737ce34dc578.

if play_services_available is set in Ant, uncomment the
FusedLocatioSensor, and vice versa
treat conditionals in xml the same as the java ones

do not allow the sim serial or subscriber id to be visible on the
external interfaces
radio sensor now knows about the preferred network type

do not close the logging writers twice, causing exceptions
set http timeout to 10 seconds and toast message on timeout

will now only overwrite preferences when default ones are more recent
new o3gm upload url
fixes to the ant play services exclusion
xmlrpc: serialize enums as the string of the state
initialize sensor timestamp and class creation and not at enable time
caught a class cast exception when no time was set on a sensor value
explicitly set socket tls version and cipher order
on first start show a dialog for the user to decide on the automatic data upload
android studio ignores and gradle updates
nested json sensor values and a library update
